channel.title: Everyday Giving Radio
channel.description: Inspiring interviews that motivate you to give back and help make the world a better place.
channel.itunes:author: Roger Carr
channel.itunes:subtitle: Interviews to inspire others to give back and make the world a better place

item.title: Interview With Author of "Do I Have A Birthday Too?: The Cheerful Givers Story"
item.description: Melane Bower is a writer, Cheerful Givers volunteer and the author of Do I Have A Birthday Too?: The Cheerful Givers Story. I had the privilege of interviewing Melane Bower about Cheerful Givers and her new book. Listen to the...
item.content:encoded:
Melane Bower is a writer, Cheerful Givers volunteer and the author of Do I Have A Birthday Too?: The Cheerful Givers Story.

I had the privilege of interviewing Melane Bower about Cheerful Givers and her new book. Listen to the interview and you will learn:

  • The Cheerful Givers mission
  • What sparked the birth of Cheerful Givers
  • What was the biggest challenge they had to overcome
  • How did they overcome that challenge
  • Tremendous examples of the impact Cheerful Givers has had on people's lives
  • Ways you can support Cheerful Givers or make "cheerful giving" a reality in your area

Go to http://www.EverydayGivingRadio.com/audio/melanebower.mp3 to listen to this interview. It will have you thinking differently about the world around you.
item.dc:creator: info@everydaygiving.com (Roger Carr)

item.title: Interview with Author of "What A Difference A Day Makes"
item.description: Kerri Cartelli is a wife, mother, teacher, sister, daughter, aunt, friend and woman. She is also the author of What a Difference a Day Makes: A Survival Guide for Women . Kerri Cartelli started her journey to writing "What A...
item.content:encoded:
Kerri Cartelli is a wife, mother, teacher, sister, daughter, aunt, friend and woman. She is also the author of What a Difference a Day Makes: A Survival Guide for Women.

Kerri Cartelli started her journey to writing "What A Difference A Day Makes: A Survival Guide for Women" when she realized that going through day to day tasks can sometimes become exhausting and she found that there were certain exercises she would do every day that made things a little easier. She is enthusiastic about helping other women enjoy life as well.

I had the privilege of interviewing Kerri Cartelli. She did not hold anything back. Kerri shared challenges she has gone through in her own life and secrets she learned to overcome those challenges. She also talked about how you can apply those secrets to give you a more balanced and peaceful life.

Go to http://www.EverydayGivingRadio.com/audio/kerri_cartelli.mp3 to listen to the interview.
item.dc:creator: info@everydaygiving.com (Roger Carr)

item.title: Boy With No Birthday
item.description: I interviewed a terrific mother and son team. They will definitely inspire you and will show you that you can make a difference, regardless of your age. I describe Cole Hodges as the "boy with no birthday" because he donates...
item.content:encoded:
I interviewed a terrific mother and son team. They will definitely inspire you and will show you that you can make a difference, regardless of your age. I describe Cole Hodges as the "boy with no birthday" because he donates his birthdays to charity. He has done this since he was five years old. Cole and his mother, Joan Crown, have now founded a non-profit organization, Donate Your Birthday, to encourage and teach others how to do the same. Listen to my interview with Cole and Joan at:

http://www.EverydayGivingRadio.com/audio/donateyourbirthday.mp3

Go to http://www.donateyourbirthday.org to learn more about Donate Your Birthday.
item.dc:creator: info@everydaygiving.com (Roger Carr)

item.title: Interview with "Tree Chick" Cindy Katz
item.description: I had the privilege of interviewing Cindy Katz from Plant A Tree USA. She has created a "green" company that is truly working to make the world a better place. She has taken massive action on a big idea and...
item.content:encoded:
I had the privilege of interviewing Cindy Katz from Plant A Tree USA. She has created a "green" company that is truly working to make the world a better place. She has taken massive action on a big idea and is succeeding! You won't wonder why when you hear the passion in her voice. Listen to the interview at:

http://www.EverydayGivingRadio.com/audio/plantatreeusa.mp3

I am sure that after you hear Cindy talk about Plant A Tree USA you are going to want to visit their website at http://www.plantatreeusa.com to learn more about the company and how you can get involved.
item.dc:creator: info@everydaygiving.com (Roger Carr)
